Napoleon became famous not only due to his intelligence and leadership talent, but also due to incredible ambitions, as well as a quick career. He began military service at 16, at 24 he already became a general, and at 34 emperor. Napoleon was the first Corsican to successfully graduate from the French Military Academy. Napoleon spent very little time sleeping - about 4 hours a day.  Napoleon, a young junior lieutenant of French artillery, in 1785 filed a petition for enrollment in the Russian imperial army. Napoleon hoped to earn enough money. But an order was issued by the Russian government that foreign officers enlisted in the Russian imperial army would receive a military rank one notch lower than that in which they had served in the former service. Napoleon did not want a demotion in rank. Napoleon obtained a personal audience with Lieutenant General Ivan Zaborovsky, who led the special commission for the recruitment of volunteers. But the meeting with the general of the Russian army did not bring the desired result. General Zaborovsky could not understand why he should make an exception for some young and unknown to anyone artillery junior lieutenant who had just recently begun his army service. And Napoleon refused to serve in Russia. Napoleon once, watched the play "Oedipus" with the Russian Emperor Alexander I, Napoleon went to sleep. Napoleon see dream of a huge Russian bear tearing Napoleon's chest and devouring the insides. Years later, Napoleon recalled this. Napoleon was shy of his growth and physique. As a result, at his headquarters all the officers were little growth, and tall and slender had no chance of making a career. Napoleon read very quickly at a speed of two thousand words per minute. Napoleon had a wonderful memory; he remembered thousands of soldiers by name. Napoleon created buttons on the sleeves of man jacket. Napoleon did this in order to wean his soldiers to wipe their noses with the edge of their outer clothing.  Napoleon was exiled to the Island of St Helena. Napoleon never went anywhere without copious amounts of his favorite brandy; Courvoisier Cognac. It’s said that the British sailors on the ships were heard to exclaim, “It’s the brandy of Napoleon Napoleon name is brand a Cognac.  Napoleon cake was named after the Napoleon. Napoleon cake - flaky, crumbly and creamy all at once, the French dessert the millefeuille — which translates as “a thousand leaves”.  In Egypt, Napoleon was so frightened of the sight of the ancient Sphinx that he ordered to shoot at him from cannons. Therefore, the nose of the Sphinx was beaten off - the cannonball blew it off.  Napoleon liked hats - in his personal collection there were more than two hundred. You must have heard that Napoleon was afraid of cats. This is actually a lie. This is his nephew, Napoleon III, suffered from ailurophobia, and not at all the great emperor. During his exile on St. Helena, Napoleon picked up a kitten, whom named Ben. Ben and Napoleon were inseparable and spent a lot of time together. Thus, one of the greatest conquerors in history was a true cat lover.  The name of the cat breed is called Napoleon. The breed was created in 1995. Cats of the Napoleon breed are animals with a surprisingly cute appearance and friendly character, extremely gentle and affectionate. The main feature of the breed is the surprisingly cute expression of the muzzle, its rounded shapes and large large eyes. The latter make even adult animals very similar to kittens. Therefore, both children and adults adore the Napoleons. During the reign of Napoleon, there were reforms that affected all spheres of French life - from education to taxation, and which are still the basis of modern France.  Napoleon's favorite horse was the Arabian stallion Marengo. Throughout the military career, Napoleon changed 130 horses. Napoleon was a good mathematician. the name Napoleon belongs to a theorem, the proof of which is attributed to Napoleon. Napoleon proposed a simple and convenient way to build a square. For his merits in mathematics, he was elected an academician of the French Academy of Sciences of that time. Napoleon loved the theater, especially Romeo and Juliet, Napoleon never applauded. The audience also did not applaud, remaining in solidarity with Napoleon, so there was always silence in the theater. One of Napoleon’s many drinking cup was made from the skull of the famous Italian adventurer Count Cagliostro.  Napoleon is considered the creator of the modern flag of Italy. In 1805, he proclaimed the name: Kingdom of Italy instead of the Cisalpine Republic, he declared himself the Italian king and approved the green-white-red flag of Italy Napoleon believed in night dreams. Napoleon sometimes fell asleep very quickly and saw dreams. On the evening of December 24, 1800, an attempt was made on the assassination of Napoleon. Napoleon had to go for an evening at the Opera.
